strengths: Strong sense of seclusion and privacy across pavilions and villas
High-touch service delivery with discreet on-property support
Architecture and setting create a calm, design-led experience

common: Best for travelers prioritizing privacy, space, and a resort-first stay
Works best when logistics and transfer expectations are set early

honeymoon: Excellent fit for honeymooners seeking seclusion and villa privacy
Strong match for celebratory stays with a calm, low-nightlife rhythm
multi_gen_family: Good fit for multi-gen families needing villa space and privacy
Less ideal for families wanting a highly programmed kids-club atmosphere
solo_wellness: Strong fit for solo wellness travelers seeking quiet, reset-oriented stays
Works well for low-distraction routines and on-property focus
corporate_executive: Selective fit for executives combining privacy with recovery time
Better for leadership retreats than high-volume meeting programs

seasonality.late_september: Late September typically suits clients seeking warm weather with a calmer post-peak rhythm.
seasonality.peak_summer: Peak Summer brings stronger demand and tighter availability windows; expectation-setting on pricing and booking lead time is essential.
seasonality.shoulder_apr_may: Shoulder Season can be attractive for value-seeking luxury travelers willing to prioritize tranquility over peak heat.
seasonality.low_nov_mar: Low season demand is narrower and operational cadence may differ; verify exact opening windows and inclusions.

risks.text: Transfer duration can feel long if not pre-framed, especially after long-haul arrivals.
Limited nightlife/off-property buzz may underwhelm travelers expecting an active evening scene.
Family programming is less intensive than some resort comparables; fit depends on privacy vs activity priorities.
